page.title: 14Agriculture in Emborough
page.content: The parish of Emborough is predominantly an agricultural area, consisting mainly of family owned and run farms, of 100 to 300 acres, laid down to good pasture, with a few acres sown to cereal and root crops. Milk production is the farmer's main livelihood. Black and white Freiesen cows can be seen grazing on lush summer grass and in winter, enjoying the warmth of large covered yards which form part of the modern day farm. These are considered a necessity as winters on Mendip are bleak. Emborough has its own cheese making factory which takes some local farmers milk. Small flocks of sheep can also be see on less productive land and some breeding pigs are kept by a few farmers as a secondary source of income.
